snippet: A secret legal review on the use of America's growing arsenal of cyberweapons has concluded that President Obama has the broad power to order a pre-emptive strike if the United States detects credible evidence of a major digital attack looming from...
abstract: A secret legal review on the use of America's growing arsenal of cyberweapons has concluded that President Obama has the broad power to order a pre-emptive strike if the United States detects credible evidence of a major digital attack looming from abroad, according to officials involved in the review, report David E. Sanger and Thom Shanker in Monday's New York Times.

headline.main: Daily Report: Broad Powers Seen for Obama in Cyberstrike
